metadata.title: CVE-2015-1606 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The keyring DB in GnuPG before 2.1.2 does not properly handle invalidpackets, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(invalid read and use-after-free) via a crafted keyring file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1606` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnupg-agent - 2.0.22-3ubuntu1.3
gnupg2 - 2.0.22-3ubuntu1.3
gpgsm - 2.0.22-3ubuntu1.3
gpgv2 - 2.0.22-3ubuntu1.3
scdaemon - 2.0.22-3ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

gnupg - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.3
gnupg-curl - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.3
gpgv - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnupg2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.22-3ubuntu1.3').
gnupg package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.16-1ubuntu2.3').
